HMP Documentation

Welcome to the HMP documentation.

HMP implements the Hidden Multivariate Pattern method that seeks to indentify trial-wise sequences of neural events in multivariate time-series data such as EEG or MEG. For more information on the method see the accompanying paper.

This documentation is designed to help you easily navigate and find the information you need. It is organized into the following four sections:

Installation Guide

The Installation Guide section provides an overview of HMP’s purpose and functionality.

notebooks/index

The notebooks/index section provides demos and examples of the HMP package in action. These notebooks are designed to help you understand how to use HMP effectively, showcasing its capabilities through practical examples.

hmp package

The hmp package is a technical reference for HMP. Here, each function, class, and module is outlined in detail, giving you a comprehensive understanding of how the package works and how to use its various functionalities. If, for example, you’d like to discover which parameters can be used for which function, you can find that here.
